channel.title: Maths problem
channel.description: i need some help with this its kinda annoying me. If you have for example a set of numbers like this 6 10 25 32 and you work out the mean which is 24.3 recurring. Now this works by equal ratio meaning that each number is of equal value when you total it up. now lets say that we have two numbers 22 56 and we want to get the mean via an unequal ratio so that 56 counts for 75% of the final answer and the 22 counts for 25% of the final answer. How would i do that? if anyone can help it would be much appreciated

item.title: Maths problem
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Much obliged i’ll see if it works

Read full topic

item.title: Maths problem
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:1, topic:202740”]22 56
and we want to get the mean via an unequal ratio so that 56 counts for 75% of the final answer and the 22 counts for 25% of the final answer. How would i do that? if anyone can help it would be much appreciated[/quote]

((56 * .75) + (22 * .25)) / 2

Read full topic

item.title: Maths problem
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

i need some help with this its kinda annoying me.
If you have for example a set of numbers like this
6 10 25 32
and you work out the mean which is 24.3 recurring. Now this works by equal ratio meaning that each number is of equal value when you total it up. now lets say that we have two numbers
22 56
and we want to get the mean via an unequal ratio so that 56 counts for 75% of the final answer and the 22 counts for 25% of the final answer. How would i do that? if anyone can help it would be much appreciated
